New Records: Suryakumar Yadav became the highest run-scorer in T20I cricket in 2022, going past Mohammad Rizwan.
Key Match Events: South Africa won by 5 wickets with 2 balls remaining.
Aiden Markram and David Miller each scored a half-century and secured a comfortable win for South Africa.
Lungi Ngidi's double strike removed India's openers, Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 68 runs, the 11th half-century of his T20I career.
Virat Kohli dropped a catch off Aiden Markram when he was on 35.
Dinesh Karthik left the field with lower back trouble, and Rishabh Pant kept in his absence.
David Miller hit successive sixes off R Ashwin to bring the required run-rate down.
Arshdeep Singh dismissed Rilee Rossouw for a duck, the third time in five innings.
Pre-Game Insights: India chose to bat first after winning the toss.
South Africa's attack was expected to perform well on the fast and bouncy Perth pitch.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa's win has significant implications for Pakistan's semi-final hopes.
Miscellaneous Highlights: South Africa's fast bowlers used the short ball to excellent effect.
India's bowlers found swing and used fuller lengths effectively.
The match conditions were enjoyable with good bounce and pace on the pitch.
